intro: Norysca hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's norysca, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white in color and bloom during the cooler months. Norysca hookeriana is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
